tourName: New Zealand classic self drive tour
placesVisited: Auckland, Waikato, Hobbiton, Rotorua, Wellington, Cross the Cook Strait to South Island, Whale watching in Kaikoura, Christchurch, Mount Cook National Park, Dunedin, Otago Peninsula, Fjordland, Cruise on Milford Sound, Queenstown, West Coast and glacier country, Stay in locally run bed and breakfasts, lodges and hotels
generalInfo:
North Island or South Island? You can explore both on this 21-day New Zealand fly drive tour which gets you to all the biggest sights, from Tongariro National Park in North Island to South Island’s glaciers.

Driving is the simplest way to reach the most scenic New Zealand locations and gives you the freedom to stop at lesser visited sights in between: that quirky roadside café, or that layby with the beautiful sea view. Twenty nights gives you an unhurried and immersive New Zealand experience.

This trip starts with North Island. You’ll pick up your car in Auckland before heading south via ‘Hobbiton’ – the film set from Lord of the Rings – in Waikato to Rotorua, and then on to Wellington. You’ll cross to South Island on the Cook Strait to Picton and then drive towards Christchurch, Queenstown and ‘glacier country’.

Exploring Maori culture is a must whilst you’re here, and there are plenty of ways to do so, whether you visit the cultural centre at Rotorua or enjoy a hangi feast, which includes dishes prepared in an earth oven – a slow cooking process that makes hearty meals out of ingredients like lamb, beef, sweet potatoes (kumara) and vegetables.

Wildlife is a massive highlight – in more ways than one. You can go whale watching at Kaikoura and watch these giants made weightless by the waves. A nighttime wildlife sanctuary tour will show you New Zealand’s more diminutive treasures, like a little spotted kiwi or hundreds of glow worms.

With all its wonderful wildlife, New Zealand is an ecologically minded country, making a responsible holiday here a natural fit. This New Zealand fly drive holiday makes use of the country’s extensive network of family-run bed and breakfasts to give you an authentic experience. These local businesses are doing their own bit to help with biodiversity on the islands, whether that’s by replanting native trees or creating wilderness areas on their properties; by staying with these inspiring hosts you can help support these endeavours.

dayInfo.description: Arrive into Auckland City Accommodation: Hotel Grand Chancellor Auckland City
Explore Auckland the 'City of Sails' Accommodation: Hotel Grand Chancellor Auckland City Meals included: Breakfast
Drive south through the rich fertile farmland of the Waikato and maybe stop at Hobbiton Village on your way to Rotorua Accommodation: Distinction Rotorua Hotel Meals included: Breakfast
Your day in Rotorua could be spent discovering Maori culture or thrilling adventure rides Accommodation: Distinction Rotorua Hotel Meals included: Breakfast
Today is filled with fantastic scenery including Lake Taupo, the Desert Road and the Kapiti Coastline as you approach Wellington Accommodation: Hotel Ibis Wellington Meals included: Breakfast
Today is free to explore the quirky city of Wellington including its cafes and great museums Accommodation: Hotel Ibis Wellington Meals included: Breakfast

Today you'll cross the Cook Strait on the Interislander Ferry. Approaching Picton you'll cruise through the spectacular Marlborough Sounds Accommodation: Picton Yacht Club Hotel Meals included: Breakfast
Drive south along the beautiful coast highway to the seaside town of Kaikoura Accommodation: The White Morph, Kaikoura Meals included: Breakfast
Spend the morning in Kaikoura before you drive through North Canterbury countryside to reach today's destination of Christchurch Accommodation: Heartland Hotel Cotswold Meals included: Breakfast
Explore the evolving city of Christchurch, or maybe take a day trip to Akaroa Accommodation: Heartland Hotel Cotswold Meals included: Breakfast
Today you'll enjoy a scenic drive through Canterbury and the MacKenzie Country Accommodation: Hermitage Hotel Room Mount Cook View Meals included: Breakfast
Leaving the MacKenzie Country you'll follow the Waitaki River to the coast, where you'll turn south for Dunedin Accommodation: Dunedin Leisure Lodge – A Distinction Hotel Meals included: Breakfast
Explore Dunedin and the Otago Peninsula Accommodation: Dunedin Leisure Lodge – A Distinction Hotel Meals included: Breakfast
Travel through the rich farmland of South Otago and Southland to reach Te Anau, gateway to Fiordland Accommodation: Distinction Luxmore Hotel Meals included: Breakfast
Today you'll journey on the magnificent Milford Road to Milford Sound for your cruise, then back to Te Anau Accommodation: Distinction Luxmore Hotel Meals included: Breakfast, Lunch
Travel through rolling Southland countryside then follow Lake Wakatipu to Queenstown Accommodation: Copthorne Hotel & Apartments Queenstown Lakeview Meals included: Breakfast, Speciality Dinner
Explore Queenstown and try one of the many activities on offer in this fun town Accommodation: Copthorne Hotel & Apartments Queenstown Lakeview Meals included: Breakfast
Take the Crown Range Road to Wanaka before travelling the spectacular Haast Pass to the West Coast Accommodation: High Peaks Hotel Meals included: Breakfast
Explore Fox Glacier and surrounds Accommodation: High Peaks Hotel Meals included: Breakfast
Drive north along the stunning West Coast Road and take the TranzAlpine train to Christchurch Accommodation: Heartland Hotel Cotswold Meals included: Breakfast
Depart Christchurch today.
